meanings.definition: To have dared more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outdared her friend to jump off the swing first.
meanings.sent2: He outdared the other climbers by reaching the summit first.
meanings.sent3: The siblings outdared each other to see who could eat the spiciest pepper.
meanings.sent4: His determination outdared any obstacle in his path.
meanings.sent5: The fearless explorer outdared the treacherous terrain to reach the hidden cave.

meanings.definition: To have challenged someone to do something daring.
meanings.sent1: The daredevil outdared his friends to skydive with him.
meanings.sent2: She outdared her classmates to try the new roller coaster.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outdared the dog to a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: His boldness outdared anyone else in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician outdared the audience to guess his next trick.
